frameDefinitions: A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
A Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a Theme to a Recipient.
The Lender gives the Theme to the Borrower with the expectation that the Borrower will return the Theme to the Lender after a Duration of time.
This frame involves a Donor transferring a Theme to a Recipient.
A Deliverer hands off a Theme to a Recipient or (more indirectly) a Goal location, which is accessible to the Recipient.
frameExamples: Shortly after the boy <t>surrendered</t> the gun, the three remaining warriors made a rush for liberty.
I am <t>lending</t> a student of mine my book on German modal particles.
The staff of Ebags <t>delivered</t> the umbrella well ahead of schedule.
listRoleDefinitions: The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The person compelled to transfer the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes possession.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The person or institution who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The object that is transferred from the <fen>Lender</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The time when the lending event occurs.
The location in which the Lender lends the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.
The object that changes ownership.
The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient.
The <fen>Donor</fen> and <fen>Recipient</fen> conceived of as a unit.
When the transfer occurs.
Where the event takes place.
This is the person who completes the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> after having transported it.
The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
The objects being delivered.
This is the <fen>Recipient</fen> of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
When the delivery takes place
The location at which the delivery takes place.
listRoleExamples: I lent the book <fex>to him</fex> for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
<fex>I</fex> lent the book to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent <fex>the book</fex> to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent him my car <fex>on Friday</fex>.
I lent him my book <fex>in Dubai</fex>.
That afternoon, <fex>a staff courier</fex> delivered the box from St. Petersburg to Largo.
I delivered the packages <fex>to the storage room</fex>.
I delivered <fex>the documents</fex> to the court house.
Tess delivered a package <fex>to Abby and her kitty</fex>.
I delivered the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>, Sir.
Barney delivered the letter on Monday <fex>in Sheboygan</fex>
